p: Dengue, a widespread acute infectious disease caused by four different serotypes of dengue virus transmitted by two types of mosquitoes; Aedes aegypti (primary vector) and Aedes albopictus [ 1], has emerged as a significant public health problem in tropical and subtropical regions of the world [ 2]. Globally, dengue incidence has increased 30 fold in the past 50 years [ 2] with 390 million cases reported annually [ 3].
